alert.note: Alert for Northern Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 04 at 2:30PM PST until February 06 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 4 AM PST MONDAY ABOVE 3500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected above 3500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches, with locally heavier amounts on higher volcanic peaks. The heaviest snowfall will be Sunday morning into Sunday afternoon. Southwest to west winds will gust to 40 mph at passes Sunday afternoon into early Sunday evening. * WHERE...In Oregon, Northern Oregon Cascades. In Washington, South Washington Cascades. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to 4 AM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult at times. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map
